intro: Cypella herbertii subsp. brevicristata, commonly known as the Herbert's cypella, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically features slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, finely divided structure. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
